home.intro: Healthcare workers caring for those with the virus need support. We connect them to service organizations providing childcare, pet care, groceries, and emotional support.

howItWorks.title: How it works
howItWorks.bullet2: We share your request with one of our trusted partner organizations.
howItWorks.bullet3: A volunteer will connect with you to fulfill your request.

faq.answer1: Our focus is on helping anyone working for a NYC medical facility or EMT service treating people suffering from COVID-19. Support staff, nurses, and doctors are all encouraged to make requests.
faq.question2: How can I be sure that my request and information stay private?
faq.answer2: We share your data securely on a per-request basis with only the service organization that will fulfill your request.
faq.question3: Does Help Supply provide the volunteer services?
faq.answer3: No. We gather requests and then route them to the most appropriate of our partner organizations to provide volunteers to fulfill them. Our current partners include {{mutualAid}}, {{workersNeedChildcare}}, and {{nycCovidCare}}.
faq.question4: How long will I have to wait for help?
faq.answer4: Many people are in difficult situations, and the volume of requests is high. Our partners will contact you as soon as they can.
faq.question5: Will you expand to other cities besides NYC?
faq.answer5: We're currently working to expand to other cities. If you are a volunteer service organization and would like to work with us, please let us know at

about.title: What we're doing
about.paragraph1: We quickly and seamlessly connect healthcare workers to the services and support they need to keep up the fight against COVID-19.
about.paragraph2: Healthcare workers have daily needs that are squeezed by the COVID-19 fight; needs like grocery shopping, childcare, pet care and mental health support are a challenge to meet. We've built relationships with trusted partners who have armies of volunteers ready to help and equipped with risk-reduction training and supplies. Launched in NYC, Help Supply is expanding to other hard-hit markets.

who.title: Who we are
who.paragraph1: We're a group of designers, technologists, medical students and community organizers from across the country who heard from the healthcare workers in their networks that they are being overwhelmed by this crisis.
who.paragraph2: Since many of us make digital products and services professionally, we decided to apply those skills to help solve everyday problems for healthcare workers so they can focus on caring for the infected.

partners.title: Our partners
partners.paragraph1: We're partnering with the following aid organizations:
partners.paragraph2: We're looking for more organizations, especially in Detroit and New Orleans. If you're an organization providing aid and want to partner with Help Supply, contact us at

loading.message: Verifying your credentials (should be a few minutes). You'll be able to edit/add once verified.

dropSiteForm.title: Set a drop-off location
dropSiteForm.description: This is where donors can drop off supplies. It should be an easily identifiable location including a street address.
dropSiteForm.notesLabel: Notes (e.g. All donated items must be unused and sealed in original packaging)
dropSiteForm.willingToPayLabel: My facility will pay for large volumes of high-quality supplies.

locationForm.description: We are currently only able to serve people in the NYC area. Mental health support is available to users in and around the city, but other services are only available in certain boroughs and neighborhoods.

where.title: Where do you want groceries delivered?
where.description: This allows us to connect you with support close to home. The volunteer providing the service will reach out to get your exact address. Our childcare partner, Workers Need Childcare, only uses licensed childcare

labels.noteRisk: Is anyone in your household at higher risk of severe illness due to COVID-19? Learn more
